4624.description: An account was successfully logged on.
4624.analyst_summary: Review these logons for unauthorized access, especially during off-hours.

4625.description: An account failed to log on.
4625.analyst_summary: Check for potential brute force attempts or misconfigured accounts.

4634.analyst_summary: Correlate this logoff with previous activities to ensure no unauthorized actions were taken.

4648.description: A logon was attempted using explicit credentials.
4648.analyst_summary: Analyze the credentials used to determine if this was a legitimate attempt or part of a broader attack.

4656.description: A handle to an object was requested.
4656.analyst_summary: Investigate the process that requested the handle to determine if it was legitimate.

4670.description: Permissions on an object were changed.
4670.analyst_summary: Review the context of the permission change to ensure no unauthorized privilege escalation occurred.

4688.description: A new process has been created.
4688.analyst_summary: Investigate the newly created process, especially if it was not part of routine operations.

4689.analyst_summary: Review the process lifecycle, especially if the exit was unexpected or abnormal.

4697.description: A service was installed in the system.
4697.analyst_summary: Ensure the service installation is authorized and not related to malware or persistence mechanisms.

4703.analyst_summary: Investigate the reason for adjusting token rights, as this may indicate privilege escalation attempts.

4776.description: The computer attempted to validate the credentials for an account.
4776.analyst_summary: Check for failed attempts to validate credentials, indicating potential unauthorized access.

4798.description: A user's local group membership was enumerated.
4798.analyst_summary: Review the reason for the enumeration, as this could be a precursor to privilege escalation.

4826.analyst_summary: Ensure that the BCD load was not manipulated, as this could be used to tamper with boot integrity.
